answer:
The MMR is a live, attenuated vaccine. Live vaccines are made from a weakened version of the germ that causes the disease, so there is no concern about transmitting a disease-causing virus from a recently vaccinated individual. If you have further questions, please contact your immunization provider.
Immunization Nurse
question: Hello, my question is..... can an individual who has just been vaccinated for MMR visit a new born baby in the hospital or visit a grandparent in a care home?
question_variation_0: can an individual who has just been vaccinated for MMR visit a new born baby in the hospital?
question_variation_2: can an individual who has vaccinated for mmr visit a new born baby
